FuncDef:
The ptp asymmetry-correction command sets an asymmetry correction value on an AP interface.
The undo ptp asymmetry-correction command cancels the setting and restores the default value.
No asymmetry correction time is set by default.
CLIs: undo ptp asymmetry-correction { positive | negative } <correction-value> interface { <interface-type> <interface-number> | <interface-name> }

ParaDef.Info:
Sets a positive asymmetry correction value.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 2000000, in ns.

Sets a negative asymmetry correction value.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 2000000, in ns.

Interface type.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 characters.

Interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 characters.

Interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 49 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Although the delay time for sending packets differs from that for receiving packets, 1588v2 considers that the opposite paths have the same delay time. To compensate for the difference between the delay time for sending packets and the delay time for receiving packets, run the ptp asymmetry-correction command to set the asymmetry correction value. A 1588v2 device automatically uses the asymmetry correction value in path delay calculation complying with the Pdelay or delay measurement mechanism.
Prerequisites
Time synchronization has been enabled for port extension using the clock time enable command.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
